intro: Potentilla meyeri var. typica, commonly known as Meyer's cinquefoil, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters and features bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has palmate leaves divided into five lobes, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and alpine landscapes. Its hardy nature and ornamental value make it a popular choice among gardeners in temperate climates.
